methods.javadoc:
Adds a layout listener
@param listener the listener
methods.name: addLayoutListener

methods.javadoc:
Removes a layout listener
@param listener the listener
methods.name: removeLayoutListener

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this layout uses articulated edges. All {@link VisualEdge}s have the ability to articulate. This method servers as a shortcut for algorithms so that they need not loop over all edges to determine if they have articulations. (Looping over large graphs is time intensive.)

{@link VisualEdge#articulations What are articulations?} @return true if this layout uses articulated edges. @see ArticulatedEdge
methods.name: usesEdgeArticulations
methods.comment:
Returns true if this layout uses articulated edges.  All VisualEdges have the
 ability to articulate.  This method servers as a shortcut for algorithms so that they 
 need not loop over all edges to determine if they have articulations.  (Looping over
 large graphs is time intensive.)
 
 VisualEdge#articulations

return.comment: true if this layout uses articulated edges.

methods.name: calculateLocations
methods.comment:
Signals to again layout the current graph.  The locations generated by the layout will
 be returned, but not actually applied to the graph.  This allows clients to generate new
 locations and then apply them in a delayed fashion, like for animation.

params.name: graph
params.comment: the graph that contains the vertices to layout

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the task monitor used to report progress or to cancel

methods.name: cloneLayout
methods.comment:
Creates a new version of this layout using the given graph.  Also, the new layout will
 have the same state as this layout (i.e., vertex positions (and edge articulations, 
 if applicable)).

params.name: newGraph
params.comment: the new graph for the new layout

methods.name: setLocation
methods.comment: Allows the client to change the location while specifying the type of change

methods.javadoc:
Returns the graph of this layout
@return the graph of this layout
methods.name: getVisualGraph
methods.comment: Returns the graph of this layout

methods.javadoc:
Returns an optional edge renderer.  This is used to render each edge.
@return an optional edge renderer
methods.name: getEdgeRenderer
methods.comment: Returns an optional edge renderer.  This is used to render each edge.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an optional edge shape transformer.  This is used to create shapes for each edge.
@return an optional edge shape transformer
methods.name: getEdgeShapeTransformer
methods.comment: Returns an optional edge shape transformer.  This is used to create shapes for each edge.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an optional custom edge label renderer.  This is used to add labels to the edges.
@return an optional renderer
methods.name: getEdgeLabelRenderer
methods.comment: Returns an optional custom edge label renderer.  This is used to add labels to the edges.

methods.javadoc: Cleanup any resource being managed by this layout.
methods.name: dispose
methods.comment: Cleanup any resource being managed by this layout.

name: VisualGraphLayout
comment: The interface for defining functions provided that are additional to that of Layout.
